content.question: Which of the following is true if the production of a good imposes external costs?

choices.label: The market supply curve lies above the social supply curve.
An appropriate government policy would be to subsidize production of the good.
A competitive market would not provide the good at all.
A competitive market would produce more than the socially optimal amount.
A persistent market surplus would occur.

content.answer: A competitive market would produce more than the socially optimal amount.
